Class ec.time.Timer 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.lang.Thread
           |
           +----ec.time.Timer
public class Timer
extends Thread
This is the approved way to get a call to happen in the future. This implementation is the one used "outside the vat"; e.g. it's the one used by StandardVat for its own timing needs. Guest loaded code only sees the wrapped version of this class.

See Also:
_ec_util_Timer

Timer()
Construct a new Timer.

run()
Implementation of method of java.lang.Runnable: the run loop for Timer.
setAbsoluteRepeatCallback(Runnable, long, int)
Register a call to be made asynchronously at the given interval of time, in absolute terms.
setAbsoluteRepeatCallback(SkippableRunnable, long, int)
This is like setAbsoluteRepeatCallback, except the thing to run is a SkippableRunnable, which, as its name implies, may end up skipping runs.
setRelativeCallback(Runnable, long, int)
Register a call to be made asynchronously after waiting at least the amount of time indicated (millis msec + nanos nanosec).
setRelativeRepeatCallback(Runnable, long, int)
Register a call to be made asynchronously at the given interval of time, in relative terms.

Timer 
 public Timer()
Construct a new Timer.

setRelativeCallback 
 public TimerCallback setRelativeCallback(Runnable runnable,
                                          long millis,
                                          int nanos)
Register a call to be made asynchronously after waiting at least the amount of time indicated (millis msec + nanos nanosec). The returned object may be used to cancel the call.

Parameters:
runnable - the Runnable to run
millis - the amount of msec to wait
nanos - the additional amount of nanosec to wait
Returns:
the callback object to use to cancel this callback
Throws: IllegalArgumentException
thrown if nanos is negative or greater than 999999
setAbsoluteRepeatCallback 
 public TimerCallback setAbsoluteRepeatCallback(Runnable runnable,
                                                long millis,
                                                int nanos)
Register a call to be made asynchronously at the given interval of time, in absolute terms. That is, successive callings will be made at original time + interval. The first call happens after waiting at least the given interval of time. The returned object may be used to cancel the call.

Parameters:
runnable - the runnable to run
millis - the amount of msec to wait per interval
nanos - the additional amount of nanosec to wait per interval
Returns:
the callback object to use to cancel this callback
Throws: IllegalArgumentException
thrown if nanos is negative or greater than 999999
setAbsoluteRepeatCallback 
 public TimerCallback setAbsoluteRepeatCallback(SkippableRunnable runnable,
                                                long millis,
                                                int nanos)
This is like setAbsoluteRepeatCallback, except the thing to run is a SkippableRunnable, which, as its name implies, may end up skipping runs.

Parameters:
runnable - the SkippableRunnable to run
millis - the amount of msec to wait per interval
nanos - the additional amount of nanosec to wait per interval
Returns:
the callback object to use to cancel this callback
Throws: IllegalArgumentException
thrown if nanos is negative or greater than 999999
See Also:
SkippableRunnable
setRelativeRepeatCallback 
 public TimerCallback setRelativeRepeatCallback(Runnable runnable,
                                                long millis,
                                                int nanos)
Register a call to be made asynchronously at the given interval of time, in relative terms. That is, successive callings will be made after waiting the interval after the call finishes. The first call happens after waiting at least the given interval of time. The returned object may be used to cancel the call.

Parameters:
runnable - the runnable to run
millis - the amount of msec to wait per interval
nanos - the additional amount of nanosec to wait per interval
Returns:
the callback object to use to cancel this callback
Throws: IllegalArgumentException
thrown if nanos is negative or greater than 999999
run 
 public void run()
Implementation of method of java.lang.Runnable: the run loop for Timer.

Overrides:
run in class Thread
